title.label: Satisfying and fun, but no cloud save

content.label:
Love shredding the mountains in this simple yet surprisingly entertaining game.
Itâ€™s holding me over â€˜till the snow comes and I can actually get out there.

My only bummer with this game is itâ€™s cloud sync -
Doesnâ€™t seem to really work. Which, yeah kinda a bummer, cause Iâ€™ll play on my phone for awhile and get all these lift tickets, but when I pick it up my iPad, none of that progress is carried over (despite having a button specifically syncing to the cloud) :/
Maybe this could be fixed though?
If so, thatâ€™d be rad! And Iâ€™d bump it up to five stars.

Okay personally, I found the game addictive but I feel like you should at least let us  have two mountains that way people will want more and will actually buy it. It is a good game and if you guys have a part two to this game you should do first person. Been playing this for a few months now. The graphics are superb on my iPad, The Snow skier play is extremely smooth and very controllable. You can play in Zen mode and just ski for fun or you can go around the ski resorts taking on different challenges to acquire ski passes. And the best part is no in app purchases or advertisements.  What are the best games out.

I saw this app on the coming soon tab so I pre ordered it. Such a fun free riding ski and snowboard game. It gives you so much freedom in the game that other games with similar concepts do not. It doesnâ€™t make you feel obligated to play and you can play on your terms and your time. However that being said I played it for almost a whole day even after I did everything I could on the first map (the free map). I am still playing on and off because it is so relaxing and stress relieving if you will. I would recommend this game to any one of any age group. I usually like more active action games however this is now one of my favorite games. I hope and pray that they do however make more free maps because 1 just isnâ€™t enough. Download this game and you will not be let down. Also I do not usually leave reviews ever but I decided I wanted to because it was such a well thought out and designed gift. I am editing this to ask please make more maps or more things to do!!!
While the game is incredibly fun to play. I have a serious problem with paying $5.00 for the full game. The free part only includes one mountain.
I literally cant do anything cause it so laggy. The character teleports, and its impossible to play the game. Please fix as this game looks really fun but I cant play it because of lag.

This game is so much fun! You have to eventually buy the whole game for only $5, but it is totally worth it to buy.there are so many ski maps with fun challenge and you can do cool tricks! This game was made really well.

I don't know what the point is to portraying a game as "free" but only giving access to one mountain that you can beat in 5 minutes and making you pay for the rest. Its a beautiful game, the controls are wonderful, although it might take some time to get used to them. I played for a legit total of 5 minutes before beating the entire mountain, and that's the only mountain available without pay. You want to just play a skiing game and relax? This ain't it. You gotta pay to relax now, you fool.
This is a calming game that deserves a lot of respect and Iâ€™m glad i stumbled Across this game. Best snowboarding game ever.

What a fantastic skiing game, and I havenâ€™t even tried the snowboarding option yet (at least I think I remember seeing an option in the game to switch from skis to a snowboard). I started with the free version and eventually paid the $4.99 for the paid version, and itâ€™s been well worth it! Itâ€™s just such a premium feeling game, from the sounds to seeing my tracks where I ski, to really everything, including the soundtrack. I smile on the inside (maybe the outside too) while I play this game. Itâ€™s my favorite game at the moment to play, very relaxing and fun (challenging too), and I highly recommend it! Itâ€™s definitely a 5 â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ app. If you havenâ€™t tried it yet, start with the free version and see what you think. As for myself, I love it!!! ðŸ‘
Iâ€™m not a gamer, but I play on occasion. This game is fantastic. After freemium version, I thought â€œIâ€™ll pay just to support this dev.â€  Well done! Appreciate the one time cost.

Downloaded this game to kill some time... now I can't put it down. Just exploring the different mountains is fun, but add in the challenges, the gimics, the tricks, and it really gets to be fun. Many challenges u can return to over and over to try to beat ur time or ur trick point score. 
The dynamics are great, and easy to pick up. Soon u are skiing, jumping, flipping, dodging rocks, etc. 
Only complaint is the number of hidden ski passes and ones in nearly impossible to reach places. Gets frustrating jumping into a fence 30-40 times.

I originally gave this 3 stars but had to come back after playing for another few days and remembering I actually spent money on this garbage. The controls and view are completely broken and it makes it nearly impossible to complete the game on an iPhone. Everything is so tiny, some little bump you canâ€™t see will throw you completely off course and because everything looks the same itâ€™s impossible to find your back without using the map. The map is also tiny and difficult to navigate, jumps around constantly, and switches to a whole new map sometimes. The controls are twitchy and inaccurate. You try to jump and nothing happens. You turn and you go flying off the map. Donâ€™t even get me started on ramps. Sometimes they send you into the next galaxy, sometimes you go 3 feet and smash into the ground. The challenges arenâ€™t fun, theyâ€™re just frustrating. The lines arenâ€™t fast or interesting, itâ€™s like trying to play frogger on skis. If you just want to ski around it gets boring fast and the map is so limited that you have to do challenges to unlock anything remotely interesting. The view is ridiculous, obviously inspired by SkiFree but in an environment this complex where you need to navigate the mountain and plot routes from run to run, itâ€™s just utterly useless. You need to be able to see far in front of you, and the only view option that allows you to see at any reasonable distance makes the player character the size on an ant. Trying to line up pinpoint accurate runs at this view level is a chore, not fun, not enjoyable. Then just when you think youâ€™re lined up, the camera decides to swing to a birds eye view, or jump to the right or left, and suddenly you have to tweak your angle to make up for it. They try to make up for it with a looking glass feature but itâ€™s a poor bandaid fix. Grinding is equally broken due to the view, controls, and absurd level of precision required. Itâ€™s near impossible to keep yourself centered on a long rail when you can barely see the skis or board thanks to the view. This whole game is like grinding for skins in a AAA game, except the reward for your grind is more grinding.  If you like being aggravated and bored at the same time, youâ€™ll love this game.

Iâ€™ve been playing this game for a while now and just recently purchased the premium feature and I have learned that this game has so much to offer! title.label: Love the game but can you provide a camera option

content.label: This game is top 10 in apps all time in my opinion but the ability to rotate the view to the back the skier would be nice I understand it would be difficult to see terrain ahead but I think it be worth it

title.label: Great game! More devs need to follow this model!

content.label: I really like this game. And I like the developersâ€™ business model even better. Itâ€™s been a long time since I played a game that started with a version you could just play WITH NO ADS, and then have the option to pay for and download the full version. BRAVO developers for this. The graphics are great, and gameplay is too. Itâ€™s a lot to put on a phone sized screen, so sometimes camera angles and the view can be less than perfect, but youâ€™re playing on a phone after all and I really enjoy playing. It has a great balance of a mission based as well as a sandbox game. Itâ€™s very challenging, and yet you can take a break and just have fun with it. Hats off for, saying it again, not making me watch ad after ad between levels just so you can take advantage of your fan base. Thank you devs for a great game and model. Even if I donâ€™t play this game forever I was happy to support the way youâ€™re doing business.

Incredibly difficult game.  If you want to spin in circles then this is for you.  I am beyond frustrated.  Supposedly tapping left goes left, tapping right goes right. If it was THAT friggin easy would I have left a review that this game is impossible to maneuver?  So now Iâ€™m an idiot?   I canâ€™t get the game to restart and the skier just spins in circles.    Typical programmer attitude, not listening to users and defending their sacred coding.    Whereâ€™s the tutorial or manual?
This game rly scratched that itch Iâ€™ve been trying to satisfy 10/10 its 3am and Iâ€™ve been playing for 4 hours.
